programme.desc: A Mail Whale Tale / Swimming With The Sharks - When Baby and William help the Mail Whale with his deliveries, they find themselves on a whale of an adventure. // Baby and his family get their own reality TV show-- what could go wrong?

However, it takes years before the first harvest. Barbabright has an idea to save time that may well lead to...disaster.

programme.desc: Paddington's Pet Hotel / Paddington Plays Golf - Paddington opens Windsor Gardens' first ever pet hotel when he has Lucky to stay over. // Baaz has set up a mini golf course at the park, but is it really unbeatable like he says and how should you hold a club Paddington?

programme.title: The Adventures of Paddington S01 Ep121

programme.title: Hey Duggee (S4) Ep12

programme.title: Eat Smart Campaign Ep2
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Chef Julz travels to Rabaul, a town of resilience destroyed and rebuilt after a volcanic eruption in 1994, to discover how the local fishing community co-exists with a belching volcano in respect, not in fear.

programme.title: Books That Made Us Ep2
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - From Kate Grenville's The Secret River in Sydney to Richard Flanagan's Death of a River Guide in Tasmania and Trent Dalton's Boy Swallows Universe in Brisbane, Claudia learns how Australia set the stage for our great stories.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons Ep13
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch throughout the day with ABC News. We've got more reporters in more places, to tell you what's happening and why it matters. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: ABC News Hour Ep13
programme.desc: There's never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the latest news and the day's top stories, with reporters on the ground to tell you what's happening and why it matters.

programme.title: ABC Evening News Ep13
programme.desc: When you need to know what's happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. We bring you the day's events from reporters across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories. Presented by Kamin Gock.

programme.title: That Pacific Sports Show Ep1
programme.desc: Sr. 3 - That Pacific Sports Show returns for 2023 with a special episode as Tiana Penitani and Sam Wykes celebrate the best and most inspiring Pacific Athletes of the past year.

programme.title: 7.30 Ep7
programme.desc: Australia's premier daily current affairs show is back in 2023, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Presented by Laura Tingle.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight Ep13
programme.desc: More news, more often - the home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the issues that matter. With a network of reporters we uncover important stories and bring you news and information you need. Presented by Kamin Gock.

programme.title: Australian Story Ep28
programme.desc: From a "nerd" named Sharon to one of Australia's most loved celebrity chefs - how Poh Ling Yeow has refined the art of reinvention and made peace with her past.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News Ep13
programme.desc: Stay in touch with the latest news and the best coverage of the day's top stories. With reporters in more places, ABC News connects communities and tells the stories that matter to you. Plus breaking news and live reports.

programme.title: Courtney Act's One Plus One Ep7
programme.desc: A decade ago Pallavi Sharda defied the odds to become the first Australian actress of Indian origin to break into Bollywood. She talks about finding success at home and abroad, and her fight for greater diversity on screen.

programme.title: The World Ep13
programme.desc: Know what's going on in our world. Yvonne Yong presents the latest international news and a complete look at today's events with reports from ABC News correspondents and interviews with experts, commentators and guests.

programme.title: Foreign Correspondent Ep28
programme.desc: In Scandinavia, the indigenous Sami have their own parliaments. But a new wave of green development is putting pressure on Sami lands, testing the power of their voice. What lessons can Australia learn from the Sami?

programme.desc: Sr. 3 - That Pacific Sports Show returns for 2023 with a special episode as Tiana Penitani and Sam Wykes celebrate the best and most inspiring Pacific Athletes of the past year.

programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. We've got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Pamela Medlen.

programme.title: Australian Story Ep28
programme.desc: From a "nerd" named Sharon to one of Australia's most loved celebrity chefs - how Poh Ling Yeow has refined the art of reinvention and made peace with her past.

programme.desc: A decade ago Pallavi Sharda defied the odds to become the first Australian actress of Indian origin to break into Bollywood. She talks about finding success at home and abroad, and her fight for greater diversity on screen.

programme.title: ABC Late News Ep13
programme.desc: Follow the story with the latest on the day's events, explaining what's happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe on the scene to cover the story. Presented by Pamela Medlen.

programme.desc: Know what's going on in our world. Yvonne Yong presents the latest international news and a complete look at today's events with reports from ABC News correspondents and interviews with experts, commentators and guests.

programme.title: The Spy Game
programme.desc: Australia's top foreign spy chief, Paul Symon, the outgoing head of the Australian Secret Intelligence Service, talks about the threat of Russia, China and what he looks for in a secret agent.

programme.title: Parkinson In Australia Ep19
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Michael Parkinson interviews guests George Negus, Chantal Contouri and Enid Lorimer.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Ep13
programme.desc: Sr. 30 - As a part of our 30th Birthday celebrations, we are diving into the archives to revisit our presenters favourite stories from over the years.

programme.title: News Breakfast: Early Ep14
programme.desc: There's always something new to talk about over breakfast. Michael Rowland and Madeleine Morris bring you the latest news and interviews to start your day, sport with Emma Rebellato and weather with Nate Byrne.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings Ep14
programme.desc: When big stories break, turn to Joe O'Brien in the mornings to bring you what's happening and why it matters. ABC News has more reporters in more places, serving and connecting communities and telling your stories.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon Ep14
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the day's top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.
